segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
2. Fuel
11. Fuel
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme …
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery. …

segments.pli: “cattārome, bhikkhave, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhavesīnaṃ vā anuggahāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four fuels. They maintain sentient beings that have been born and help those that are about to be born.
What four?

segments.pli: Kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ.
segments.en: Solid food, whether coarse or fine; contact is the second, mental intention the third, and consciousness the fourth.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhavesīnaṃ vā anuggahāya.
segments.en: These are the four fuels that maintain sentient beings that have been born and help those that are about to be born.

segments.pli: Ime, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā?
segments.en: What is the source, origin, birthplace, and root of these four fuels?

segments.pli: Ime cattāro āhārā taṇhānidānā taṇhāsamudayā taṇhājātikā taṇhāpabhavā.
segments.en: Craving.

segments.pli: Taṇhā cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā?
segments.en: And what is the source, origin, birthplace, and root of craving?
Feeling.

segments.pli: Vedanā cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā?
segments.en: And what is the source of feeling?
Contact.

segments.pli: Phasso cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidāno kiṃsamudayo kiṃjātiko kiṃpabhavo?
segments.en: And what is the source of contact?
The six sense fields.

segments.pli: Saḷāyatanañcidaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ?
segments.en: And what is the source of the six sense fields?
Name and form.

segments.pli: Nāmarūpañcidaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ?
segments.en: And what is the source of name and form?
Consciousness.

segments.pli: Viññāṇañcidaṃ, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ?
segments.en: And what is the source of consciousness?
Choices.

segments.pli: Saṅkhārā cime, bhikkhave, kiṃnidānā kiṃsamudayā kiṃjātikā kiṃpabhavā?
segments.en: And what is the source of choices?
Ignorance.
And so, ignorance is a condition for choices.
Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
When choices cease, consciousness ceases. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha defines the four kinds of “food” or “nutriment”, which include edible food, contact, intention, and consciousness. These are all produced by craving, and hence connect with dependent origination.
